results.title: Christ stopped at Eboli = Cristo si e' fermato a Eboli
results.creator_credit: Radiotelevisione Italiana, TV2, VIDES Cinematografica, Franco Cristaldi, Nicola Carraro and Francesco Rosi
results.brief_description: This four part mini-series (which was also released as a feature film in a condensed form) is based on the autobiography of Carlo Levi, writer, painter, doctor and avowed anti-fascist. In 1935 Levi was exiled to Lucania in the extreme south of Italy for his political activities. In this remote peasant land so cut off from the domain of history that even Christ never arrived, so the locals say, Levi discovered a way of life which transformed him. He felt more strongly the weight of age-old injustices and went back to the roots of these injustices. ‘This film is a journey through my own conscience and through that of all men who carry a Lucania in themselves’ (Rosi). Cast includes: Gian Maria Volonte, Paolo Bonacelli, Alain Cuny, Irene Papas. Written by Francesco Rosi, Tonino Guerra, Raffaele la Capria ; photography, Pasqualino De Santis ; music, Piero Piccioni. Italian dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Christ Is Risen
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, William Canning and Colin Low
results.brief_description: Focuses on the Easter service in the Russian Orthodox Church of St Peter and St Paul in Montreal. The depth of the emotion touched by this ancient ceremony is reflected in the film. Filmed in a shadowy, taper-lit space, sonorous with chanting voices, and coloured with occasional views of icons and frescos, the film shows an absorbing religious experience.

results.title: Chris Sanders: potter
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
This is a film about potter, Chris Sanders, working under the direction of an experienced master potter. After having had his own workshop for five years, Chris realised that he needed to learn more about the craft, and this could be best done under the guidance of a master potter. Both Chris and his master discuss this experience.

results.title: Chris Patten's east and west
results.creator_credit: Peter Minns, BBC and Oxford Film and Television
results.brief_description: Former Governor of Hong Kong, Chris Patten provides a politico-economic tour of some countries affected by the Asian economic crisis, speaking with many of the leading economists and politicians involved. He assesses the repercussions of changing attitudes towards Asia, shows how the collapse of the economies of South East Asia have effected ordinary people, and discusses Asian culture and values that have build up over time.

results.title: Chris Cree Brown: electronic composer
results.creator_credit: Hugh McDonald, New Zealand National Film Unit and Chris Dillon
results.brief_description: Shows electronic composer Chris Cree Brown recording taped music, discovering sounds in the environment and stressing that one should listen to new sounds in a receptive way. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Chouans! (Cinemascope Print)
results.creator_credit: Ariel Zeitoun and Philippe De Broca
results.brief_description:
Aristocrat, philosopher and inventor, Count Savinien de Kerfadec loses his wife as she gives birth to their daughter, Celine. The same night he brings home Aurele, a newborn he found of the doorstep of the church. A few years later, young Tarquin who is on his way to the seminar, runs away and becomes the third addition to the eccentric Kerfadec household. As the children grow up, a love triangle develops, until the day the boys are sent away to make their way in the world. In 1793, Tarquin comes back to Brittany as a representant of the Republic, in charge of repressing the uprising in the Western provinces and possibly woe Celine. But Aurele and Celine, whose love for each other has blossomed, are active among those called ‘Les Chouans’.

Credits: Producer, Ariel Zeitoun ; director, Philippe de Broca ; writers, Daniel Boulanger, Philippe de Brocca, Jerome Tonnerre ; photography, Bernard Zitzermann ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Sopphie Marceau, Lambert Wilson, Philippe Noiret, Stephane Freiss, Jean-Pierre Cassel, Roger Dumas.

results.title: Chorus and principals on stage please: the making of Lakme
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Film Australia, Opera Australia and Oliver Howes
results.brief_description: This compelling film of interest to opera lovers features Australian stars Joan Sutherland and Richard Bonynge. We are taken behind the Sydney Opera House curtain to explore many of the preparations required to stage such an opera as “Lakme”. With shooting undertaken in Sydney and New York, the film leaves a lively impression of the problems of running an opera. Features the Australian Opera, the Elizabethan Sydney Orchestra and the Dance Company of New South Wales. Script by Caroline Jones and Damien Parer as Unit Manager.

results.title: Chopin
results.creator_credit: Theodora Olembert, Triangle Productions and Jean Mitry
results.brief_description: An appraisal of Chopin’s life and work. By original photographs and engravings we follow the composer’s tumultuous experiences in Poland, France, England and Scotland at a time of revolution and change. The selection of works played in this film by the Polish pianist Malcuzynski demonstrates the composer’s influence on the development of pianoforte technique; an influence which has given him a permanent place in history. Commentary by Pierre Gascan and spoken by Peter Coke.

results.title: Choosing what to make
results.creator_credit: Craig Witty and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Using animation, puppets and clay figures, this film examines fundamental factors involved in the production of goods (labour, resources etc). Discusses the importance of intelligent allocation of resources and emphasises the significance of demand in determining what to produce. Suitable for primary school level.
